what: Prediction scores for people living with HIV
title: Prediction scores for people living with HIV
text: hivscore package implementation VACS Index 1, VACS Index 2 Dat’AIDS score.

title: Prediction scores for people living with HIV
text: can install development version hivscore package like :
code: remotes::install_github("jaromilfrossard/hivscore")

title: Prediction scores for people living with HIV
text: can compute VACS Index 1: VACS Index 2, use: Dat’AIDS score can computed using:
code: library(hivscore) data("vacs1") vacs1$score_vacs1 <- score_vacsindex1(   age = vacs1$age, cd4_count = vacs1$cd4, hiv1_rna = vacs1$hiv1_rna,   hgb = vacs1$hgb, fib4 = vacs1$fib4, egfr = vacs1$egfr,   hepc = vacs1$hepc) head(vacs1) #>   age cd4 log_hiv1_rna hgb fib4 egfr hepc alb wbc bmi hiv1_rna vacs1    vacs2 #> 1  52 435          1.7  14 1.34   90 TRUE   4 5.5  25       50    23 51.11143 #> 2  30 435          1.7  14 1.34   90 TRUE   4 5.5  25       50    11 38.98529 #> 3  35 435          1.7  14 1.34   90 TRUE   4 5.5  25       50    11 44.19800 #> 4  40 435          1.7  14 1.34   90 TRUE   4 5.5  25       50    11 47.50081 #> 5  45 435          1.7  14 1.34   90 TRUE   4 5.5  25       50    11 49.47464 #> 6  50 435          1.7  14 1.34   90 TRUE   4 5.5  25       50    23 50.70043 #>   score_vacs1 #> 1          23 #> 2          11 #> 3          11 #> 4          11 #> 5          11 #> 6          23 data("vacs2") vacs2$score_vacs2 <- score_vacsindex2(   age = vacs2$AGE, cd4_count = vacs2$CD4,vl_log = vacs2$VL_LOG,   hgb = vacs2$HGB,fib4 = vacs2$FIB4,egfr = vacs2$EGFR,   hepc = vacs2$HEPC==1, alb = vacs2$ALB, bmi = vacs2$BMI,   wbc = vacs2$WBC) head(vacs2) #>   PARAM SET AGE  CD4 VL_LOG HGB FIB4 EGFR HEPC ALB  WBC  BMI SCORE_V2 #> 1    98  98  75   10    5.0   9 7.50    0    1   2 11.0 15.0  173.467 #> 2    99  99  75 1000    1.3   9 7.50    0    1   2 11.0 15.0  136.322 #> 3     0  50  52  435    1.7  14 1.34   90    0   4  5.5 25.3   44.419 #> 4     1   1  30  435    1.7  14 1.34   90    0   4  5.5 25.3   32.293 #> 5     1   2  35  435    1.7  14 1.34   90    0   4  5.5 25.3   37.506 #> 6     1   3  40  435    1.7  14 1.34   90    0   4  5.5 25.3   40.808 #>   score_vacs2 #> 1   173.46689 #> 2   136.32164 #> 3    44.41904 #> 4    32.29290 #> 5    37.50561 #> 6    40.80842 data("dataids") dataids$dataids <- score_dataids(   age = dataids$age,cd4_count = dataids$cd4_count, nonhiv_cancer = dataids$nonhiv_cancer,   cardio_disease = dataids$cardio_disease,egfr = dataids$egfr, cirrhosis = dataids$cirrhosis,   low_bmi = dataids$low_bmi,anemia = dataids$anemia) head(dataids) #>   age cd4_count nonhiv_cancer cardio_disease egfr cirrhosis low_bmi anemia #> 1  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE   FALSE  FALSE #> 2  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE   FALSE   TRUE #> 3  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE    TRUE  FALSE #> 4  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE    TRUE   TRUE #> 5  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70      TRUE   FALSE  FALSE #> 6  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70      TRUE   FALSE   TRUE #>   SCORE_DATAIDS dataids #> 1             0       0 #> 2             6       6 #> 3            10      10 #> 4            16      16 #> 5            13      13 #> 6            19      19

title: Prediction scores for people living with HIV
text: Using Dat’AIDS score, can predict survival probabilities 1 year:
code: dataids$surv_prob1 <- surv_dataids(1, score = dataids$dataids) head(dataids) #>   age cd4_count nonhiv_cancer cardio_disease egfr cirrhosis low_bmi anemia #> 1  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE   FALSE  FALSE #> 2  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE   FALSE   TRUE #> 3  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE    TRUE  FALSE #> 4  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70     FALSE    TRUE   TRUE #> 5  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70      TRUE   FALSE  FALSE #> 6  62       550         FALSE          FALSE   70      TRUE   FALSE   TRUE #>   SCORE_DATAIDS dataids surv_prob1 #> 1             0       0  0.9938032 #> 2             6       6  0.9886812 #> 3            10      10  0.9831056 #> 4            16      16  0.9692791 #> 5            13      13  0.9772061 #> 6            19      19  0.9586541

title: Prediction scores for people living with HIV
text: VACS Index 1: Tate, J. P., Justice, . C., Hughes, M. D., Bonnet, F., Reiss, P., Mocroft, ., … & Sterne, J. . (2013). internationally generalizable risk index mortality one year antiretroviral therapy. AIDS (London, England), 27(4), 563. Bebu, ., Tate, J., Rimland, D., Mesner, O., Macalino, G. E., Ganesan, ., … & Infectious Disease Clinical Research Program HIV Working Group. (2014). VACS index predicts mortality young, healthy HIV population starting highly active antiretroviral therapy. Journal acquired immune deficiency syndromes (1999), 65(2), 226. Justice, . C., Modur, S., Tate, J. P., Althoff, K. N., Jacobson, L. P., Gebo, K., … & Gange, S. J. (2013). Predictive accuracy Veterans Aging Cohort Study (VACS) index mortality HIV infection: north American cross cohort analysis. Journal acquired immune deficiency syndromes (1999), 62(2), 149. VACS Index 2:  McGinnis, K. ., Justice, . C., Moore, R. D., Silverberg, M. J., Althoff, K. N., Karris, M., … & Study, V. . C. (2021). Discrimination Calibration Vacs Index 2.0 Predicting Mortality Among People Hiv North America. Clinical Infectious Diseases: Official Publication Infectious Diseases Society America. Dat’AIDS score: Hentzien M, Delpierre C, Pugliese P, Allavena C, Jacomet C, Valantin M-, et al. (2018) Derivation internal validation mortality risk index aged people living HIV: Dat’AIDS score. PLoS ONE 13(4): e0195725. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0195725

title: Anemia — anemia
text: Anemia

title: Anemia — anemia
code: anemia(hgb, sex)

title: Anemia — anemia
text: hgb Numeric. Hemoglobine. g/dL. sex Character. Either "male" "female".

title: Anemia — anemia
text: Logical. TRUE hgb < 13 g/dL. female, TRUE hgb < 12 g/dL.

title: Baseline survival function — baseline
text: Baseline survival function

title: Baseline survival function — baseline
code: basesurv_hentzien2018(time)  basesurv_riskgroup_hentzien2018(time)

title: Baseline survival function — baseline
text: time Numeric. Time year.

title: Baseline survival function — baseline
text: basesurv_hentzien2018 given Hentzien (2018): $$S_0(t) = 1-0.00562t - 0.00057679t^2$$ basesurv_riskgroup_hentzien2018 given Hentzien (2018): $$S_0(t) = 1-0.00610t - 0.00050468t^2$$

title: Baseline survival function — baseline
text: Hentzien M, Delpierre C, Pugliese P, Allavena C, Jacomet C, Valantin M-, et al. (2018) Derivation internal validation mortality risk index aged people living HIV: Dat'AIDS score. PLoS ONE 13(4): e0195725. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0195725

title: Conversion of units. — convert
code: conv_g.ml_to_g.dl(x)  conv_g.dl_to_g.ml(x)  conv_mul_to_mm3(x)  conv_mm3_to_mul(x)  conv_K.ml_to_K.mm3(x)  conv_K.mm3_to_K.ml(x)  conv_cm_to_m(x)  conv_m_to_cm(x)  conv_mumol.l_to_mg.dl(x)  conv_mg.dl_to_mumol.l(x)

title: Conversion of units. — convert
text: numerical vector.

title: Conversion of units. — convert
text: conv_g.ml_to_g.dl(): g/ml g/dl. \(1/100\). conv_g.dl_to_g.ml(): g/dl g/ml. x\(100\). conv_mul_to_mm3(): \(\mu\)l mm\(^3\). x\(1\). conv_mm3_to_mul(): mm\(^3\) \(\mu\)l. x\(1\). conv_K.ml_to_K.mm3(). count per ml count per mm\(^3\). \(1/1000\). conv_K.mm3_to_K.ml(). count per mm\(^3\) count per mL. x\(1000\). conv_cm_to_m(). cm m. \(1/100\). conv_cm_to_m(). m cm. x\(100\). conv_mumol.l_to_mg.dl(). \(\mu\) mod per l mg per dl. x \(0.0113096584483149\) conv_mg.dl_to_mumol.l(). mg per dl \(\mu\) mod per l. \(1/0.0113096584483149\)

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
text: Compute Dat'AIDS score survival prediction

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
code: surv_dataids(   time,   score = NULL,   basesurv_fun = basesurv_hentzien2018,   eta_fun = eta_dataids,   age = NULL,   cd4_count = NULL,   nonhiv_cancer = NULL,   cardio_disease = NULL,   egfr = NULL,   cirrhosis = NULL,   low_bmi = NULL,   anemia = NULL )  eta_dataids(   score = NULL,   beta_score = 0.1008354015,   age = NULL,   cd4_count = NULL,   nonhiv_cancer = NULL,   cardio_disease = NULL,   egfr = NULL,   cirrhosis = NULL,   low_bmi = NULL,   anemia = NULL )  eta_riskgroupdataids(   score = NULL,   beta_score = c(`0-3` = 0, `4-13` = 0.81868, `14-19` = 1.76034, `>=20` = 2.61992),   age = NULL,   cd4_count = NULL,   nonhiv_cancer = NULL,   cardio_disease = NULL,   egfr = NULL,   cirrhosis = NULL,   low_bmi = NULL,   anemia = NULL )  score_dataids(   age,   cd4_count,   nonhiv_cancer,   cardio_disease,   egfr,   cirrhosis,   low_bmi,   anemia )  riskgroup_dataids(score)  points_dataids()

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
text: time Numeric. Time prediction year. score Numeric. Dat'AIDS score. NULL, score computed using predictors. basesurv_fun Function time. Default basesurv_hentzien2018. eta_fun Function score returns linear predictor. Default eta_dataids eta_riskgroupdataids available. age Numeric. Age year. cd4_count Numeric. Count CD4 cell/mm\(^3\). nonhiv_cancer Logical. TRUE diagnosis non-HIV cancer. cardio_disease Logical. TRUE diagnosis cardiovascular disease. egfr Numeric. Estimated glomerular filtration rate. (ml/min/1.73m\(^2\)). cirrhosis Logical. TRUE cirrhosis diagnostic. low_bmi Logical. TRUE BMI < 18.5. anemia Logical. TRUE anemia defined hemoglobin <12g/dL female <13g/dL male. beta_score Numberic. Default 0.1008354015 continuous score c("0-3"=0, "4-13"=0.81868, "14-19"=1.76034, ">=20"=2.61992) risk group. Parameter associated score.

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
text: Numeric. Predicted survival probability.

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
text: prediction survival time t : $$\hat{S}(t) = S_0(t)^{\exp{b*\text{score}}}$$, \(S_0(t)\) basesurv_fun \(b\) beta_score. score_dataids() returns numerical vector, points_dataids() returns list parameters used compute VACS Index 1 surv_dataids() returns survival probabilities baseline survival function.

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
text: Hentzien M, Delpierre C, Pugliese P, Allavena C, Jacomet C, Valantin M-, et al. (2018) Derivation internal validation mortality risk index aged people living HIV: Dat'AIDS score. PLoS ONE 13(4): e0195725. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0195725

title: Dat'AIDS score — dataids_score
code: data(dataids) dataids$dataids <- score_dataids(     age = dataids$age, cd4_count = dataids$cd4_count,     nonhiv_cancer = dataids$nonhiv_cancer, cardio_disease = dataids$cardio_disease,     egfr = dataids$egfr, cirrhosis = dataids$cirrhosis, low_bmi = dataids$low_bmi,     anemia = dataids$anemia)

title: Discretization of the numeric variables used in the VACS Index 1 and Dat'AIDS score — discretize
code: data(dataids) dataids_d<-   data.frame(     age = dataids$age,     age_d = discrete_age_dataids(dataids$age),     cd4 = dataids$cd4_count,     cd4_d = discrete_cd4_dataids(dataids$cd4_count),     egfr = dataids$egfr,     egfr_d = discrete_egfr_dataids(dataids$egfr)) head(dataids_d) #>   age age_d cd4 cd4_d egfr egfr_d #> 1  62 60-64 550 >=500   70   >=60 #> 2  62 60-64 550 >=500   70   >=60 #> 3  62 60-64 550 >=500   70   >=60 #> 4  62 60-64 550 >=500   70   >=60 #> 5  62 60-64 550 >=500   70   >=60 #> 6  62 60-64 550 >=500   70   >=60  data(vacs2) vacs2_d <-   data.frame(     age = vacs2$AGE,     age_d = discrete_age_vacs1(vacs2$AGE),     cd4 = vacs2$CD4,     cd4_d = discrete_cd4_vacs1(vacs2$CD4),     vl = 10^vacs2$VL_LOG,     vl_d = discrete_hiv1rna_vacs1(10^vacs2$VL_LOG),     egfr = vacs2$EGFR,     egfr_d = discrete_egfr_vacs1(vacs2$EGFR),     fib4 = vacs2$EGFR,     fib4_d = discrete_fib4_vacs1(vacs2$FIB4),     hgb = vacs2$HGB,     hgb_d = discrete_fib4_vacs1(vacs2$HGB)) head(vacs2_d) #>   age age_d  cd4   cd4_d           vl  vl_d egfr egfr_d fib4 fib4_d hgb  hgb_d #> 1  75  >=65   10     <50 100000.00000 >=1e5    0    <30    0 >=3.25   9 >=3.25 #> 2  75  >=65 1000   >=500     19.95262  <500    0    <30    0 >=3.25   9 >=3.25 #> 3  52 60-64  435 350-499     50.11872  <500   90   >=60   90  <1.45  14 >=3.25 #> 4  30   <50  435 350-499     50.11872  <500   90   >=60   90  <1.45  14 >=3.25 #> 5  35   <50  435 350-499     50.11872  <500   90   >=60   90  <1.45  14 >=3.25 #> 6  40   <50  435 350-499     50.11872  <500   90   >=60   90  <1.45  14 >=3.25

what: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
text: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula

title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
code: egfr(scr, age, sex, race)  egfr_norace(scr, age, sex)

title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
text: scr Numeric. Serum creatinine \(\mu\) mol/L age Numeric. Year. sex Character. Either "male" "female". race Character. Either "","white", "black", "hispano-american", "asian", "unknown". Specifying race = "black" change formula eGFR.

title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
text: numeric

title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
text: See references formula. egfr() uses formula Levey et al. (2009), egfr_norace() uses formula Inker et al. (2021).

title: Estimated glomerular filtration rate formula — egfr
text: Levey, . S., Stevens, L. ., Schmid, C. H., Zhang, Y., Castro III, . F., Feldman, H. ., ... & CKD-EPI (Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration)*. (2009). new equation estimate glomerular filtration rate. Annals internal medicine, 150(9), 604-612. Inker, L. ., Eneanya, N. D., Coresh, J., Tighiouart, H., Wang, D., Sang, Y., ... & Levey, . S. (2021). New creatinine-cystatin C–based equations estimate GFR without race. New England Journal Medicine, 385(19), 1737-1749.
